remarks: In a ring, ` 0 = 1 ` iff the ring contains only ` 0 ` .  (Contributed by Jeff Madsen, 6-Jan-2011.)
statement:
0ring.1 $e |- G = ( 1st ` R ) $.
0ring.2 $e |- H = ( 2nd ` R ) $.
0ring.3 $e |- X = ran G $.
0ring.4 $e |- Z = ( GId ` G ) $.
0ring.5 $e |- U = ( GId ` H ) $.
0rngo $p |- ( R e. RingOps -> ( Z = U <-> X = { Z } ) ) $.
